titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to photograph album 'Collection Le Khedive' - E.D. Laurens AD.MC.041
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman for Akkasah: Center for Photography at NYUAD

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 18:36:19 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Egyptian cigarette card album composed of portraits of Egyptian royalty, ethnographic portraits and archaeological sites, reproduced as small-format photographs. EDOUARD LAURENS established his cigarette brand in 1885 in Brussels, Belgium, in 1887 he established a factory in Alexandria, Egypt. In 1888 Mohamed Tewfik Pasha (Khedive of Egypt and the Sudan between 1879 and 1892 and the sixth ruler from the Muhammad Ali Dynasty) gave Laurens the right to use the brand name "Khedive" and his portrait. In the 1890's Laurens opened a branch in Munich, in 1908 in London), in 1913 at Geneva, c. 1920 in Wiesbaden (Germany), and in 1921 at The Hague.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection was processed as it was received.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: NYU Abu Dhabi holds all copyright and related rights pertaining to this collection. Please contact Akkasah at akkasah@nyu.edu for information regarding information and use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Le Khedive Collection; AD_MC_041; box number; folder number or item identifier; Akkasah Center for Photography, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in acid-free paper and box. The album is scheduled for digitization in 2020.
